00025 class AUDACITY_DLL_API Ruler {
00026  public:
00027 
00028    enum RulerFormat {
00029       IntFormat,
00030       RealFormat,
00031       RealLogFormat,
00032       TimeFormat,
00033       LinearDBFormat,
00034    };
00035 
00036    //
00037    // Constructor / Destructor
00038    //
00039 
00040    Ruler();
00041    ~Ruler();
00042 
00043    //
00044    // Required Ruler Parameters
00045    //
00046 
00047    void SetBounds(int left, int top, int right, int bottom);
00048 
00049    // wxHORIZONTAL || wxVERTICAL
00050    void SetOrientation(int orient);
00051 
00052    // min is the value at (x, y)
00053    // max is the value at (x+width, y+height)
00054    // (at the center of the pixel, in both cases)
00055    void SetRange(double min, double max);
00056 
00057    //
00058    // Optional Ruler Parameters
00059    //
00060 
00061    // IntFormat, RealFormat, or TimeFormat
00062    void SetFormat(RulerFormat format);
00063 
00064    // Specify the name of the units (like "dB") if you
00065    // want numbers like "1.6" formatted as "1.6 dB".
00066    void SetUnits(wxString units);
00067 
00068    // Logarithmic
00069    void SetLog(bool log);
00070 
00071    // Minimum number of pixels between labels
00072    void SetSpacing(int spacing);
00073 
00074    // If this is true, the edges of the ruler will always
00075    // receive a label.  If not, the nearest round number is
00076    // labeled (which may or may not be the edge).
00077    void SetLabelEdges(bool labelEdges);
00078 
00079    // Makes a vertical ruler hug the left side (instead of right)
00080    // and a horizontal ruler hug the top (instead of bottom)
00081    void SetFlip(bool flip);
00082 
00083    // Set it to false if you don't want minor labels.
00084    void SetMinor(bool value);
00085 
00086    // Good defaults are provided, but you can override here
00087    void SetFonts(const wxFont &minorFont, const wxFont &majorFont, const wxFont &minorMinorFont);
00088 
00089    // The ruler will not draw text within this (pixel) range.
00090    // Use this if you have another graphic object obscuring part
00091    // of the ruler's area.  The values start and end are interpreted
00092    // relative to the Ruler's local coordinates.
00093    void OfflimitsPixels(int start, int end);
00094 
00095    //
00096    // Calculates and returns the maximum size required by the ruler
00097    //
00098    void GetMaxSize(wxCoord *width, wxCoord *height);
00099 
00100 
00101    // The following functions should allow a custom ruler setup:
00102    // autosize is a GREAT thing, but for some applications it's
00103    // useful the definition of a label array and label step by 
00104    // the user.
00105    void SetCustomMode(bool value);
00106    // If this is the case, you should provide a wxString array of labels, start
00107    // label position, and labels step. The range eventually specified will be
00108    // ignored.
00109    void SetCustomMajorLabels(wxArrayString *label, int numLabel, int start, int step);
00110    void SetCustomMinorLabels(wxArrayString *label, int numLabel, int start, int step);
00111    
00112    //
00113    // Drawing
00114    //
00115 
00116    // Note that it will not erase for you...
00117    void Draw(wxDC& dc);
00118    void Draw(wxDC& dc, Envelope *speedEnv, long minSpeed, long maxSpeed);
00119    // If length <> 0, draws lines perpendiculars to ruler corresponding
00120    // to selected ticks (major, minor, or both), in an adjacent window.
00121    // You may need to use the offsets if you are using part of the dc for rulers, borders etc.
00122    void DrawGrid(wxDC& dc, int length, bool minor = true, bool major = true, int xOffset = 0, int yOffset = 0);
00123 
00124    // So we can have white ticks on black...
00125    void SetTickColour( const wxColour & colour)
00126    { mTickColour = colour; mPen.SetColour( colour );}
00127 
00128  private:
00129    void Invalidate();
00130    void Update();
00131    void Update(Envelope *speedEnv, long minSpeed, long maxSpeed);
00132    void FindTickSizes();
00133    void FindLinearTickSizes(double UPP);
00134    wxString LabelString(double d, bool major);
00135 
00136    void Tick(int pos, double d, bool major, bool minor);
00137 
00138    // Another tick generator for custom ruler case (noauto) .
00139    void TickCustom(int labelIdx, bool major, bool minor);

00238 // This is an Audacity Specific ruler panel which additionally
00239 // has border, selection markers, play marker.
00240 // Once TrackPanel uses wxSizers, we will derive it from some 
00241 // wxWindow and the GetSize and SetSize functions
00242 // will then be wxWidgets functions instead.
00243 class AUDACITY_DLL_API AdornedRulerPanel : public wxPanel
00244 {
00245 public:
00246    AdornedRulerPanel(wxWindow* parent,
00247                      wxWindowID id,
00248                      const wxPoint& pos = wxDefaultPosition,
00249                      const wxSize& size = wxDefaultSize,
00250                      ViewInfo *viewinfo = NULL);
00251 
00252    ~AdornedRulerPanel();
00253 
00254 public:
00255    static int GetRulerHeight() { return 28; }
00256    void SetLeftOffset(int offset){ mLeftOffset = offset; }
00257 
00258    void DrawCursor(double pos);
00259    void DrawIndicator(double pos, bool rec);
00260    void DrawSelection();
00261    void ClearIndicator();
00262 
00263    void SetPlayRegion(double playRegionStart, double playRegionEnd);
00264    void ClearPlayRegion();
00265    void GetPlayRegion(double* playRegionStart, double* playRegionEnd);
00266    
00267    void SetProject(AudacityProject* project) {mProject = project;};
00268    void GetMaxSize(wxCoord *width, wxCoord *height);
00269 
00270 private:
00271    void OnErase(wxEraseEvent &evt);
00272    void OnPaint(wxPaintEvent &evt);
00273    void OnSize(wxSizeEvent &evt);
00274    void OnMouseEvents(wxMouseEvent &evt);
00275    void OnCaptureLost(wxMouseCaptureLostEvent &evt);
00276

00278    void DoDrawMarks(wxDC * dc, bool /*text */ );

00280    void DoDrawSelection(wxDC * dc);
00281    void DoDrawIndicator(wxDC * dc);
00282    void DoDrawPlayRegion(wxDC * dc);
